title: Domaine Vrignaud 2015 La Champréaux  (Chablis)
description: From a single parcel on the Vrignaud domaine, the wine has 30% wood aging. That gives a ripe full character which emphasizes the rich vintage. Toast mingles with rich apples and touches of citrus. Drink this refreshing wine from 2017.

title: Macari 2015 Katherine's Field Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Bigger, bolder swathes of fresh grapefruit, gooseberry and citrus distinguish the Katherine's Field from it's sister bottling, the Life Force. Fermented in stainless steel, it's a more primary, forward expression of fruit but with an equally refreshing backbone of acidity. Hints of dusty oyster shell and lime pith lend nuance to the finish. Drink now through 2019.

title: Le Chiuse 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Aromas of wild berry, blue flower, tilled soil and a whiff of dark spice lead the nose on this luminous wine. Savory and smooth, the easy-drinking palate presents black cherry, star anise and clove while bright acidity and polished tannins provide the sleek framework.

title: Leverage 2014 Trajectory Red (Paso Robles)
description: Restrained on the nose, this blend of 41% Grenache, 32% Syrah and 22% Mourvèdre offers black plum, milk chocolate, purple flower and vanilla on the nose. Black peppercorns show strongly on the palate along with black-plum skins and cola, but this still needs some bottle age to emerge to full potential.

title: Lexington 2013 Gist Ranch Estate Malbec (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Blueberry, blackberry, black pepper and smoke swirl into a rather reserved and elegant nose on this bottling, one of the few Malbecs made in the mountainous region. There is great tannic tension to the acid-driven palate, with blackcurrant and dried-violet flavors adding to that blackcurrant and black-pepper base.

title: Lion-Gri 2013 Naturalles Muscat (Moldova)
description: Aromas of honeysuckle and apricot lead the way to flavors of roasted almond, orange blossom and dried apricot in this golden-colored sweet Muscat wine from Moldova. There's a nice amount of acidity to prevent this wine from being cloying.

title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Napa County)
description: A larger offering from the producer, this is made predominantly from Pinot Noir, with smaller additions of Chardonnay, Pinot Gris and Pinot Meunier. Bright in lemony acidity, it shows texture and a lasting, rich mousse drizzled in raspberry and cherry.

title: Señorío de Cuzcurrita 2011  Rioja
description: Reduced prune aromas are rubbery, herbal and not fully convincing. On the palate, this is gritty, tannic and tight, with tomatoey acidity. Oaky grapy flavors are compact, while graphite is noted on a finish that's weighted down by bulky tannins.

title: Vermeil 2013 Compassion Red (California)
description: Very sweet and supple, this red dessert wine has a light perfume of roses and prunes. Rich, ripe fruit flavors come with a full body and soothing, wrap-around texture. The finish is long and sweet, too.

title: Vigilance 2014 Cimarron Red (Lake County)
description: Complex, flavorful but not too big, this layered wine has aromas like cedar and tobacco, and flavors like black cherry and mint. It offers a medium-full body and velvety texture.

title: Toad Hollow 2015 Francine's Selection Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Bright citrus and green-apple flavors lift this wine above the usual butterballs in terms of freshness and lively texture. It is medium bodied, clean and appetizing.

title: Gimenez Mendez 2015 Las Brujas Tannat (Canelones)
description: Plum, blueberry, tea and earth notes make for an interesting set of aromas. This is a very good example of Uruguayan Tannat, even if the tannins are unresolved and clampy. Toasty top flavors shadow blueberry fruit, while this is dark and slightly bitter on the finish. Drink this tasty but choppy wine through 2020.

title: Zuccardi 2014 Emma Bonarda (Uco Valley)
description: Initial rubbery, the oaky and smoky aromas give way to blueberry and plum scents. Hard tannins are cut by juicy acidity, while this tastes of blackberry, dark plum and bacon. Persistent hard-driving tannins are abrasive on the finish, which holds onto racy acidity and core berry fruit flavors.

title: Casas del Bosque 2013 Late Harvest Riesling (Casablanca Valley)
description: Honeyed aromas of wheat bread and stone fruits are not as convincing as the wine's citrus, melon and honey flavors, which are supported by a full almost-sticky body. A creamy, chunky finish, like the palate, pulls up short of sticky.

title: Celler Bàrbara Forés 2014 Coma d'En Pou Red (Terra Alta)
description: Mild but honest plum and berry aromas lead to a slightly scratchy and grabby palate with fresh acidity. Toasty, earthy, spicy red-berry flavors are long across the finish, with spice and black-pepper notes. This is 75% Garnacha and 25% Syrah.

title: Château des Bachelards 2014 Grand Vin Gamay (Comtés Rhodaniens)
description: This is the first vintage at this Fleurie property by new owner Alexandra de Vazeilles. It is rich, full of red fruits with considerable acidity. Hints of the 12 months wood aging show in the spice and smoothness at the end. The wine is ready to drink.

title: 100 Percent Wine 2012 All Profits to Charity Red (California)
description: Juicy and fresh, this deeply colored wine offers lots of grapey, berry-like aromas and equally fruity and vivid flavors. It has a touch of sweetness and a soothing, smooth texture. The name refers to the winery's pledge to give 100% of profits to charity.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2008 Conde Valdemar Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Gritty earthy nutty aromas announce a slightly stale wine that comes up a little short in terms of purity of fruit and freshness. A good mouthfeel is a positive, while flavors of tomato, spice and gritty, roasted berry and plum finish toasty, peppery and burnt. Drink now.

title: Budureasca 2015 Origini Reserve Sauvignon (Dealu Mare)
description: Floral notes of elderflower, dried daisy and lemon blossom precede flavors of passion fruit and gooseberry in this medium-bodied wine. The finish is long with pleasant crisp acidity.

title: Columbia Crest 2014 H3 Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Aromas of toast, char, and milk chocolate along with blue and black fruit are followed by velvety soft fruit flavors. It shows an appealing sense of balance and polish.

title: Corte Adami 2015 Cimalto  (Soave Classico)
description: This offers enticing scents of white spring flower and green apple. The juicy palate doles out pineapple, peach and tangerine while a note of candied drop wraps up the finish.

title: Domaine Chancelle 2014  Saumur-Champigny
description: A year's maturation and wood aging have produced this smooth, rich wine. The tannins are integrated into the red fruits that burst out of the glass. Aromatic and spicy, the wine is still full of young fruitiness and will be better from late 2017.

title: Kim Crawford 2013 Small Parcels Rise and Shine Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: This is a fairly muscular rendering of Central Otago Pinot Noir. Plum, herb, espresso and charred oak notes mark the nose and palate, while the finish shows some gritty tannins. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Pask 2014 Gimblett Gravels Syrah (Hawke's Bay)
description: Despite this wine's dark hue, it's refreshingly drinkable and not overly extracted. Hints of licorice highlight black cherry and blueberry fruit, and there's a touch of graham cracker mixed in for some extra complexity. It's a fine value at the price, which is unusually reasonable for Syrah from Hawke's Bay.

title: Fox Run 2012 Riesling 11 Lake Dana Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: A favorite within Fox Run's unique geology wine series, an exploration of specific vineyard terroir against specific vinification styles, the 11 Lake Dana Vineyard offers a lovely balance between rustic earth elements and more pristine expressions of fruit and flower. Concentrated tangerine and lemon flavors are honeyed and sweet yet elegantly balanced by tones of black tea, blossom and smoked nut. The finish lingers on a pleasantly astringent note.

title: Finca Decero 2013 Remolinos Vineyard Malbec (Agrelo)
description: Roasted, gritty, herbal berry aromas are more rustic than polished. This feels big but obtuse. Flavors of blueberry and savory plum are a touch salty and leathery, while this tastes of briny blue fruits on an oaky, grabby finish.

title: Prima Materia 2013 Arkao Red (Dunnigan Hills)
description: Vivid boysenberry and blackberry flavors seem to gush from this medium-bodied, smooth and mouth-filling wine. Made from 65% Carmenere plus Cabernet Sauvignon and a dash of Barbera, it has a grapey, fruity exuberance but tastes dry and moderately tannic, too, so it's balanced for enjoying with food.

title: Manastira 2011 Ibar Reserve Mavrud-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Thracian Valley)
description: This Mavrud-Cabernet Sauvignon blend is inky garnet in color with aromas of black cherry, smoke, tobacco and cassis. In the mouth, there are flavors of pomegranate, black cherry and tart cherry with silky tannins and a smooth finish.

title: Lisini 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Rose, violet, wild berry and a whiff of forest floor lead the nose on this young, approachable red. The bright, savory palate offers morello cherry, raspberry and aromatic herb set against firm acidity and polished tannins. A blast of orange zest closes the finish.

title: Olivier Leflaive 2014 Les Cloux Premier Cru  (Rully)
description: This wine from the Côte Chalonnaise is a lighter style of Chardonnay than Leflaive's rich Côte de Beaune wines. It's a delicious lightly toasty wine that has crisp acidity and a strong and refreshing dose of lemon juice. The wine is creamy at the end. It will be ready to drink from 2017.
